section.names: gd0202:\ the\ parameter\ of\ the\ delegate\ signature\ of\ the\ signal\ is\ not\ supported
section.title: GD0202: The parameter of the delegate signature of the signal is not supported

paragraph.strong: 修复是中断修复还是非中断修复

entry.paragraph: Breaking - If the parameter type is changed
Non-breaking - If the [Signal] attribute is removed

section.title: 原因
section.paragraph: An unsupported type is specified for a parameter of a delegate annotated with the [Signal] attribute when a Variant-compatible type is expected.

section.title: 规则说明
section.paragraph: Every signal parameter must be Variant-compatible so it can be marshalled when emitting the signal and invoking the callbacks.
Take a look at the C# signals documentation for more information about how to declare and use signals.

section.names: how\ to\ fix\ violations 如何解决冲突
section.title: 如何解决冲突
section.paragraph: To fix a violation of this rule, change the parameter type to be Variant-compatible or remove the [Signal] attribute from the delegate. Note that removing the attribute will mean the signal is not registered.

tip.paragraph: If the signal doesn't need to interact with Godot, consider using C# events directly. Pure C# events allow you to use any C# type for its parameters.

section.names: when\ to\ suppress\ warnings 何时禁止显示警告
section.title: 何时禁止显示警告
section.paragraph: Do not suppress a warning from this rule. Signal delegates with parameters that can't be marshalled will result in runtime errors when emitting the signal or invoking the callbacks.
